title: Air Fryer Pakoras Recipe
description: These air fryer pakoras made with chopped cauliflower, potatoes, onion, chickpea flour, and spices are cooked with less oil for a crisp appetizer.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Air Fryer Pakoras 4.1 (10) 9 Reviews 3 Photos These air fryer pakoras have all the things you love about pakoras but without the deep frying. Don't forget the yogurt dipping sauce! Submitted by Soup Loving Nicole Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 cups chopped cauliflower 1 ¼ cups chickpea flour (besan) 1 cup diced yellow potatoes ¾ cup water ½ red onion, chopped 1 tablespoon salt 1 clove garlic, minced 1 teaspoon curry powder 1 teaspoon coriander ½ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper, or more to taste ½ teaspoon cumin cooking spray Directions Mix together cauliflower, chickpea flour, potatoes, water, red onion, salt, garlic, curry powder, coriander, cayenne pepper, and cumin in a large bowl until well combined. Set batter aside to rest for 10 minutes. Preheat the air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease the basket of the air fryer with cooking spray. Spoon 2 tablespoons batter into the prepared basket and flatten. Repeat this as many times as the basket space allows without the pakoras touching. Mist the top of each pakora with cooking spray. Cook in the preheated air fryer for 8 minutes. Flip and cook for 8 more minutes. Transfer pakoras to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat steps 3 and 4 with remaining batter. Add Your Photo Photos of Air Fryer Pakoras 01 of 03 Photo by  cricky87 02 of 03 Photo by  cricky87 09/17/2019 Loved the texture and taste of these pakoras! I used sea salt and they were way too salty but I will try again. I recommend a very small dice on the potatoes and cauliflower or they won't cook through. I used a T-fal actifry without the spinning arm and followed the recipe for cook time. 03 of 03 Photo by  Soup Loving Nicole 02/25/2019 1 You’ll Also Love Air Fryer Onion Bhaji 4 Ratings Crispy Vegetable Pakoras 114 Ratings Air Fryer Buffalo-Ranch Chickpeas 6 Ratings Spiced Air-Fried Chickpeas 10 Ratings Meatless Dairy-Free Taco Dip 1 Rating Easy Beet Hummus 5 Ratings Sweet Potato Chips in the Air Fryer 6 Ratings Air Fryer Potato Chips 14 Ratings Indian Chole Aloo Tikki 51 Ratings Pumpkin Curry with Lentils and Apples 65 Ratings Air Fryer Falafel 5 Ratings Sweet Potato Hummus 35 Ratings Pineapple Salsa 156 Ratings Game Day Black Bean Dip 6 Ratings Black Bean Salsa 196 Ratings Kurkuri Bhindi (Crispy Okra) in the Air Fryer 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Soup Loving Nicole
instructions: Mix together cauliflower, chickpea flour, potatoes, water, red onion, salt, garlic, curry powder, coriander, cayenne pepper, and cumin in a large bowl until well combined. Set batter aside to rest for 10 minutes.;Preheat the air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease the basket of the air fryer with cooking spray.;Spoon 2 tablespoons batter into the prepared basket and flatten. Repeat this as many times as the basket space allows without the pakoras touching. Mist the top of each pakora with cooking spray.;Cook in the preheated air fryer for 8 minutes. Flip and cook for 8 more minutes. Transfer pakoras to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat steps 3 and 4 with remaining batter.
